Description: Fragment of round handle from a Brindisi pottery transport amphora. Clay near fine strong pink-buff; mixed inclusions; cream surface. Rectangular stamp at top of handle with Latin inscription.
Curator's comments: Name Lucius. cf. Desy, Ph., Les timbres amphoriques de l'Apulie republicaine (Oxford 1989) 168. P. Palazzo, Le anfore di Apani (Brindisi), Rome 2013, 58-60. Petrie diary, 1884-1885 (EES Archive XVII 47) has several examples.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (JB.1288)
